Text: I’m outraged by the Supreme Court’s reckless decision to overturn #RoeVWade. This puts countless women in jeopardy here in Indiana and across America. This November, we have a clear choice to make when it comes to women’s health, and I urge every Hoosier to vote accordingly.

Democrats have delivered under the Biden Administration by passing the American Rescue Plan and the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act.

This morning I had the absolute honor to receive the endorsement of the Marion County Democratic Party for the Indiana’s 7th Congressional District. To truly show our appreciation, we must pay our teachers what they deserve, and make sure their schools have proper funding. #NationalTeacherAppreciationWeek https://t.co/SMZD9m3qS2

I am disappointed by the decision to end Indiana’s mask mandate, but I am pleased Indianapolis' leadership made the right call to keep it in place in Indy. #MaskUpIndy https://t.co/HHTc6Y7NGa
While millions of Hoosiers have been vaccinated and there is light at the end of the tunnel, now is not the time to end proven preventive measures to stop COVID’s spread.
Call the Chair of the Elections Committee, Rep. Wesco, at 317-232-9753, to share your opposition to this legislation!
If this pandemic has taught us anything, it is that we need to make it easier for everyone to vote no matter the circumstances.
The bill would make it more difficult for Hoosiers to vote-by-mail, which is a lifeline for people who are disabled, are sick, or have limited mobility for a number of other reasons.

I am extremely disheartened that Republicans in the Indiana General Assembly think that making it harder for Hoosiers to vote is going to protect our Democracy, but that's exactly what Senate Bill 353 does.
#HappyEaster to those celebrating today! While we are still not all able to gather together, I am hopeful this year will bring a sense of renewal for our country. https://t.co/Z4NDdGiVsY

Today is the day! All Hoosiers 16+ are now eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine. Go to https://t.co/D9peqMDg1i or call 211 to schedule your appointment. This is your opportunity to protect yourself and others from this dangerous virus!

Great news, fellow Hoosiers! Beginning Wednesday, March 31, all Indiana residents 16+ will be eligible to register for the Covid-19 vaccine. When it’s your turn, go to https://t.co/D9peqMDg1i to schedule an appointment. https://t.co/kwKUFKfp2c

On this day eleven years ago, President Obama signed the Affordable Care Act into law. Since then, millions of Americans have acquired affordable healthcare. Thank you Presidents Obama and Biden for your work on this incredibly important issue. https://t.co/ZRxJmnl2BE

Thank you Chairman Zody and Vice Chair Cordelia Lewis-Burks for your years of service.

March Madness is here! Indianapolis is geared up and ready to safely host the NCAA Basketball Tournament. Teams from all over the country will get to experience our great city and state. This is an opportunity to show the world what Hoosier hospitality is all about. #MaskUpIndy

Thank you to all the amazing women elected officials here in Marion County! They put in the hard work everyday to make our community a better place for all. I am so proud and honored to work alongside them! #WomensHistoryMonth https://t.co/B33slQh1db

Next stop: President Biden’s desk! The #AmericanRescuePlan is one of the most progressive and overarching legislations to pass in recent history. It will get families back on track, cut childhood poverty in half, save small businesses, beat COVID-19, and bolster our economy.

The #PROAct will give workers the chance to join a union and gain the rights they deserve. It is critical that unions continue to have the opportunity to advocate on behalf of their members. The House has done its job; I urge the Senate to pass this bill!

On this day in 1965, Rep. Lewis was savagely beaten in his pursuit for equal voting rights for all Americans, but he persevered. Let's always remember his words: “The vote is powerful. It is the most powerful nonviolent tool we have in a democratic society." https://t.co/3mycCaMkQK

Hoosiers 50+ are now eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine! Make your appointment today at https://t.co/D9peqMDg1i. Additionally, teachers under 50 years old are now eligible to receive their vaccine at Meijer, Kroger, or Walmart.

Over 1 million Hoosiers have received their first dose of the #COVID19 vaccine. This is a huge milestone for our state! Please get your vaccine as soon as it is available to you, and keep wearing your mask and social distancing. For more information visit https://t.co/D9peqMDg1i

Another historic Covid-19 relief bill has passed the House! The American Rescue Plan Act will provide immediate relief to millions of Americans, increase vaccine rollout, help schools reopen safely, and so much more. America is hurting. We need the Senate to pass this bill now!

Today, I proudly cast my vote for the #EqualityAct. Now, it is time for this bill to become law! This will finally provide protections to our LGTBQ+ Americans against discrimination in their everyday lives. I will continue to be a friend, advocate, and supporter in these efforts!

56 years ago #OTD, #Malcolm X, American Muslim minister and human rights activist, was assassinated. Though his life was cut short, he will always be remembered for his efforts to uplift the Black community. https://t.co/r9UUXwbLF4

This week we lost a powerful and loving leader in our community. Wilson Allen was a friend to many, including me and my grandmother. He was a fearless advocate for the LGTBQ+ community. We must continue to fight in his memory for a safe and accepting community for all.

Today on World Cancer Day, we honor the countless lives that have been lost to this terrible disease. I pledge to continue my efforts to help find a cure, as well as uplift the survivors and those currently battling cancer. https://t.co/ps8Msvs73F

Today is a day for the history books!  Congratulations to President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris on being sworn into office. I am looking forward to working with you and your administration to build back a better country together! https://t.co/6bH4xXTnCC

Today on Martin Luther King Jr. Day, we celebrate the life of this fearless leader and his struggle for civil rights and voting rights.
